description: From Latin delibatus (“diminished, tasted”), past participle of delibo (“I take away from, I taste from”); de- + libo (“I taste”).

verbs.description: delibate (third-person singular simple present delibates, present participle delibating, simple past and past participle delibated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To taste; to take a sip of.
